title: Fontana, California
summary: Fontana is a city in San Bernardino County, California. Founded by Azariel Blanchard Miller in 1913,[1] it remained essentially rural until World War II, when entrepreneur Henry J. Kaiser built a large steel mill in the area. It is now a regional hub of the trucking industry, with the eastâ€“west Interstate 10 and State Route 210 crossing the city  and Interstate 15 passing diagonally through its northwestern quadrant.
